info.name: C2M API v2 – Real World Use Cases
info.description:
Real-world use cases for the C2M API v2. Each folder contains pre-populated requests for specific business scenarios.

**Getting Started:**
1. **Select Environment** (top-right dropdown) → Choose 'C2M Mock Server'
2. **Find this collection** → In the Collections sidebar, locate 'C2M API v2 – Real World Use Cases'
3. **Expand the collection** → Click the arrow next to 'C2M API v2 – Real World Use Cases'
4. **Choose a use case folder** → Click arrow next to a folder (e.g., 'Legal Firm')
5. **Expand the POST request** → Click arrow next to 'POST [single-doc-job-template]'
6. **Select an example** → Click one of the pre-filled examples (e.g., 'legal_firm - Document ID + Credit Card + New Address')
7. **Review the Body tab** → See the pre-populated request data for this scenario
8. **Click Send** → Response includes jobId for the submitted job

**Use Case Scenarios:**

**Legal Firm** - We have letters that we need to send all day. Each letter is sent to a specific recipient via Certified Mail. A copy is sent to their legal representative via First Class mail. Our system generates the PDF of the letter.
`[single-doc-job-template]`

**Company #1** - We send invoices at the end of the month. Each invoice is in its own PDF. The address of the recipient is in the invoice.
`[multi-pdf-address-capture]`

**Company #2** - We send invoices at the end of the month. All the invoices are in a single big PDF. The addresses of the recipients are in the invoices.
`[single-pdf-split-addressCapture]`

**Real Estate Agent** - We send postcards as part of our campaign. The postcards have a specific template and use mail merge.
`[single-doc-job-template]`

**Medical Agency** - We send medical reports to patients. Each report is a custom PDF. In addition, a few boiler-plate pages of generic medical information are sent with each report.
`[multi-doc-merge-job-template]`

**Monthly Newsletters** - We are an organization that sends out flyers at the beginning of each month to our subscribers. The flyer is a static document and we have a mailing list it has to go out to.
`[single-doc-job-template]`

**Reseller #1** - We receive PDFs from our customers. Each PDF is unique. We want to batch the PDFs into a single big PDF and send them in one go.
`[single-pdf-split]`

**Reseller #2** - We receive PDFs from our customers. Each PDF is unique. We want to zip the PDFs and send them in one go.
`[multi-doc]`

**Note:** JWT tokens are handled automatically - no manual auth needed!

exec: // This script automatically handles JWT token acquisition and refresh
// Skip auth for token endpoints themselves
// Check if we have client credentials
console.warn('Client credentials not configured. Set clientId and clientSecret in environment.');
// Function to get a new token
console.error('Failed to get token:', response.code, response.status);
// If no token, get a new one
console.log('No token found, acquiring new token...');
// Add token to request if we have one
// FIX: Check URL host (resolved) OR baseUrl variable (for templates)
// Check both the resolved host AND the baseUrl variable
console.log('✅ JWT token obtained and Authorization header ADDED (real API detected)');
console.log('⏭️  JWT token obtained and saved, but Authorization header SKIPPED (mock server detected)');
console.warn('No token available - request may fail with 401');
